{{WPMILHIST |class=start |<!-- B-Class-1. It is suitably referenced, and all major points have appropriate inline citations. --> |B-Class-1=no <!-- B-Class-2. It reasonably covers the topic, and does not contain obvious omissions or inaccuracies. --> |B-Class-2=yes <!-- B-Class-3. It has a defined structure, including a lead section and one or more sections of content. --> |B-Class-3=yes <!-- B-Class-4. It is free from major grammatical errors. --> |B-Class-4=yes <!-- B-Class-5. It contains appropriate supporting materials, such as an infobox, images, or diagrams. --> |B-Class-5=yes |Middle-Eastern-task-force=yes }} {{WikiProject Syria|class=start|importance=low}}
== Incorrect name ==
The names "Base 80" or "80th base" are not correct. 80 doesn't refer to the base, but to the 80th brigade which was stationed there (before the war). So the correct term should be "80th Brigade military base" or "Brigade 80 military base".
Could someone please change it here and in the main Battle of Aleppo page? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Aleppo_%282012-13%29 [[User:ZFR77|ZFR77]] ([[User talk:ZFR77|talk]]) 01:16, 13 November 2013 (UTC)
:My edit was reverted with the note: "Doesn't matter what its called in Arabic, this is the english wikipedia, and I counted that 4 sources in the section call it base 80 while 3 call it brigade 80. So...."
:The fact remains that the number 80 refers to the brigade, and not the base (military bases in Syria are not assigned numbers). I don't want to start edit warring, but I still think it should be changed, especially since enough English sources support this. [[User:ZFR77|ZFR77]] ([[User talk:ZFR77|talk]]) 16:57, 21 November 2013 (UTC)
== Maaret al-Artiq ==
Former army colonel who commanded another rebel brigade was killed in fighting in the Maaret al-Artiq area. [http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/86539/World/Region/Syria-air-strike-hits-Islamist-brigade-leadership.aspx Ahram] and [http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2013/Nov-16/238022-syrian-regime-forces-target-rebel-commanders.ashx#axzz2k3r8IiK5 The Daily Star][[User:Roma-borisov|Roma-borisov]] ([[User talk:Roma-borisov|talk]]) 12:16, 16 November 2013 (UTC)
== Sheikh Najjar ==
Meanwhile, Syria's state-run news agency said the Syrian army carried out "intensive, successful qualitative operations" against armed rebels in the northern province of Aleppo, eliminating several groups with all of their weapons and equipments. The operations took place at Kastello, Sheikh Najjar, west of Khan al-Asal town, al-Bab, and east of al-Nairab area among others, the report said.[http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/827130.shtml#.UpHEQaA5S61 Global Times][http://www.philstar.com/world/2013/11/24/1260376/rebels-attack-syrias-key-oil-facilities-amid-fierce-fights Phil Star][http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2013-11/24/c_125751839.htm Xinhua][http://english.eastday.com/e/131124/u1a7792716.html eastday Eastday][http://wikimapia.org/#lang=en&lat=36.262546&lon=37.246742&z=12&m=h&show=/28105571/Shaykh-Najar Wikimapia][[Special:Contributions/37.52.27.151|37.52.27.151]] ([[User talk:37.52.27.151|talk]]) 10:54, 24 November 2013 (UTC)
State tv is not a reliable source. If State tv gets used, yallasouriya gets used [[User:Sopher99|Sopher99]] ([[User talk:Sopher99|talk]]) 21:32, 24 November 2013 (UTC)
::yallasouriya is just a blog which collects pro-opposition tweets, quit being a whiny ass.[[User:Rob2013|Rob2013]] ([[User talk:Rob2013|talk]])--[[Special:Contributions/75.34.42.44|75.34.42.44]] ([[User talk:75.34.42.44|talk]]) 04:48, 1 December 2013 (UTC)
==Correction for last report==
"On 28 November, government and rebel forces clashed in the outskirts of Aziziyeh, leaving 20 government fighters and 11 rebels dead" the fight didnt take place in the outskirts of "Aziziyeh" but near Aziza town which is west of the Aleppo Airport. Check on the SOHR it will say "Aziza". Here is the link showing [http://wikimapia.org/1358166/Al-Aziza Aziza] which is a under the Syrian Military control.[[User:Rob2013|Rob2013]] ([[User talk:Rob2013|talk]]--[[Special:Contributions/75.34.42.44|75.34.42.44]] ([[User talk:75.34.42.44|talk]]) 04:48, 1 December 2013 (UTC)
== External links modified ==
Hello fellow Wikipedians,
I have just added archive links to {{plural:7|one external link|7 external links}} on [[Aleppo offensive (October–December 2013)]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=712479689 my edit]. You may add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it, if I keep adding bad data, but formatting bugs should be reported instead. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether, but should be used as a last resort. I made the following changes: *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=244302743 *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://cphpost.dk/international/two-danes-allegedly-die-fighting-syria *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gz6wr66r6Oa38fRV4RQH7uwZd2pA?docId=7ab4cb0a-40ef-49b8-b757-5b337a3ee3a0&hl=en *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/syrian-troops-rebels-clash-south-damascus-20862696 *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jgjqXCmuwr4UFF4iJS4h653Nu7ig?docId=32cb00c4-4218-4b94-88e2-b3d86e0a4231 *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://abna.ir/data.asp?lang=3&Id=481871 *Attempted to fix sourcing for http://www.france24.com/en/20131121-fighting-aleppo-base-kills-15-syria-militia-ngo
When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}).
{{sourcecheck|checked=true}}
Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|<sup style="color:green;font-family:Courier">cyberbot II]]<small><sub style="margin-left:-14.9ex;color:green;font-family:Comic Sans MS">[[User talk:Cyberbot II|<span style="color:green">Talk to my owner]]:Online</sub></small> 09:57, 29 March 2016 (UTC)
